data.title: Visit and Explore Blenheim Palace
data.meta_description: Find out about everything to do at Blenheim Palace. Including the Palace, Parkland, Formal Gardens, Tours, Experiences and more. With hidden treasures galore and over 300 years of rich history to explore, a visit to Blenheim Palace is sure excite and inspire.
data.text:
The Bridgerton Trail

Stand in the stunning locations of the Netflix / Shondaland series Bridgerton and Queen Charlotte: A Bridgerton Story and walk in the footsteps of their…

Summer at Britain's Greatest Palace

Make the most of your summer and enjoy a picture perfect day out at Britainâs Greatest Palace.

The Palace State Rooms

Enter the Palace and explore our gilded State Rooms with their priceless collections of portraits, tapestries and furniture.

'Upstairs' Tour

An exclusive tour of the Marlborough family's private apartments, with secret corridors, spiral staircases and a history of illustrious guests.

'Downstairs' Tour

Glimpse into the lives of Palace staff over the centuries on the âDownstairsâ Tour.

Blenheim Palace Adventure Play

Our new adventure play, is open! A secret world where imaginations can run wild.

The Churchill Exhibition

Our Churchill Exhibition features a mix of historic artefacts and new technology, documenting key aspects of the adventurous life of Sir Winston Churchill,…

British Sign Language Tours

On the last Tuesday of the month of every month, join us at the Palace for our free British Sign Language-interpreted tours.

Rowse Honey Hive

Thereâs a real buzz at Blenheim Palace with the unveiling of the Rowse Honey Hive down at our Walled Garden. This exciting new interactive space invites…

The Blenheim Story Exhibition

Blenheim Palace has stood for more than 300 years, but why was it first built and who were the first residents of this stunning example of Baroque architecture…

Sir Winston Churchill's Birth Room

The tiny bedroom where Sir Winston Churchill was born has re-opened at Blenheim Palace, after being closed to visitors for more than a year.

Walk in Churchill's Footsteps

Follow the trail of our 'Greatest Briton' at Blenheim Palace to discover Sir Winston Churchill's most cherished places.

Formal Gardens

Discover the unique history of our Formal Gardens, reflecting a journey through the styles of the ages.

Buggy Tours of the Formal Garden

Find out about the history of our beautiful Formal Gardens and how they've been continued to be cared for by our Gardens Team.

Blenheim Palace Tree Trail

Our Tree Trail walk will take you on a journey through the magnificent landscape of our historic estate.

Marlborough Maze

Find your way out of the Walled Gardensâ beautiful Marlborough Maze; two miles of yew trees inspired by the history of the Palace.

The Stables Exhibition

Explore our new immersive and interactive family exhibition in the Palaceâs historic stable block showcasing the importance of horses at Blenheim through…

Blenheim Palace Fire Engine

We are delighted to announce that the Blenheim Palace Fire Engine has returned to its original home
